intro: Somphoxylon wullschlaegelii, commonly known as the Wullschlaegel's spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its succulent stems and alternate, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are surrounded by modified leaves called cyathia. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and is adapted to thrive in dry conditions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
